newsitem.title: USA: Zytec surges 30 percent on EPS forecast.
newsitem.headline: Zytec surges 30 percent on EPS forecast.

text.p: Zytec Corp shares soared more than 30 percent on Thursday after the company said it expects second quarter earnings to significantly top analysts' estimates.
"It certainly seemed to stimulate some interest and my guess is attract some momentum players," said Clinton Morrison, an analyst with John G. Kinnard & Co.
Shares of Zytec closed up 5-7/8 at 25-1/8 after hitting a day's high of 25-1/4. The last time the stock topped 23 was in May 1996.

Zytec said early Thursday it expects second quarter earnings to range from $0.39 to $0.41 a share, up from $0.22 a share (adjusted) in the 1996 second quarter. The company, which provides electronic power conversion equipment for the communications, networking and computer industry, said this exceeds analysts' average estimates of $0.31 a share by about 30 percent.

Morrison said, however, he does not expect the company to post $0.40 a share earnings in the third and fourth quarters. "It's a wonderful company, and I think it's got a lot of potential," Morrison said. "It certainly deserved a nice pop, but I have a hard time saying it deserved six bucks.... This is not the benchmark quarter."
